channel.title: The Pudding
channel.description: The Pudding is an editorial publication that explains ideas debated in culture with visual essays.

item.title: A People Map of the UK
item.description: Where city names are replaced by their most Wikipedia’ed resident.

item.description: Where city names are replaced by their most Wikipedia’ed resident.

item.title: How Often Names are in Songs
item.description: Every song seems to be written about "Baby". Where does your name stack up?

item.title: How Much Data Lies Behind the Paper You're Reading?
item.description: Want to access the raw data behind an academic paper? Good luck.

item.title: The Rise of Hyphenated Last Names in Pro Sports
item.description: Since the 1990s names that arch over jerseys have become more common.

item.title: The NBA Has a Defensive Three Seconds Problem
item.description: NBA refs: stay in your lane. NBA players: don't mind if we do.

item.title: Colorism in High Fashion
item.description: We looked at 19 years of covers to find how Vogue represents women of all shades.

item.title: Why Budapest, Warsaw, and Lithuania split themselves in two
item.description: Explaining how the European Union calculates wealth distribution

item.title: How Algorithms Know What You’ll Type Next
item.description: Exploring how text prediction really works

item.title: Women's Issues Within Political Party Platforms
item.description: How often do women’s issues appear in party platform documents over time?

item.description: Can you spell the hardest names in the NBA?

item.title: Who is the Biggest Pop Star?
item.description: Today, there's no single way to measure popularity in music.

item.title: How Many High School Stars Make It in the NBA?
item.description: Every year the top high school basketball recruits get hyped up—do they pan out?

item.title: The Gyllenhaal Experiment
item.description: The many ways to misspell the hardest names in pop culture.

item.title: The Sexualized Messages Dress Codes are Sending to Students
item.description: What we learned about sexualization from analyzing 481 high school dress codes
